## Price and volume data

- Free sources like Yahoo usually suffer from survivorship bias
  - Only have data on currently existing companies
  - Will miss poor returns of companies that delisted
- Bloomberg, FactSet, Capital IQ, ...


## Company financials and actions

- Yahoo only goes back 5 years
- Could scrape SEC's EDGAR site
- FactSet, Capital IQ, and others

## Yahoo adjusted close

- Yahoo's adjusted close is split and *dividend* adjusted.
- Pct change in adjusted close $\sim$ close-to-close return
- On ex-dividend days, pct change in adj close is

. . .

$$P_t / (P_{t-1}-D_t)$$

. . .

which is not exactly but is close enough to

. . .

$$(P_t + D_t)/P_{t-1}$$



## Returns from Yahoo in python

```{.p code-line-numbers="1|2-3|4-5"}
from pandas_datareader import DataReader as pdr
data = pdr('cvx', 'yahoo', start=2010)
price = data['Adj Close']
ret = price.pct_change()
ret.plot()
```

. . .

```{python}
from pandas_datareader import DataReader as pdr
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib as mpl
mpl.rcParams['legend.fontsize'] = 'x-large'
mpl.rcParams['axes.titlesize'] = 'xx-large'
mpl.rcParams['axes.labelsize'] = 'xx-large'
mpl.rcParams['xtick.labelsize'] = 'x-large'
mpl.rcParams['ytick.labelsize'] = 'x-large'

data = pdr('cvx', 'yahoo', start=2010)
price = data['Adj Close']
ret = price.pct_change()
plt.subplots(figsize=(16,4))
_ = ret.plot()
```

## Factor investing

- Factors are stock characteristics for which stocks that share the characteristic
  - tend to move together
  -  have had higher average returns than other stocks
- High ROE is an ingredient in quality factors.
- [Factor investing at BlackRock](https://www.blackrock.com/us/individual/investment-ideas/what-is-factor-investing){.external target="_blank"}
- [Factor investing at AQR](https://www.aqr.com/Learning-Center/Systematic-Equities/Systematic-Equities-A-Closer-Look?gclid=Cj0KCQiA_8OPBhDtARIsAKQu0gZS3uj9A0fdCN5eB_P-uUfY0VWr2uY9MW503bgPnO7DbQeVr2_WlxkaAlwhEALw_wcB){.external target="_blank"}
